tit.cmt: ・「巨勢」は大文字にしました。

sen.j: 巨勢 邑治（こせ の おおじ、？- 神亀3年6月6日 (旧暦)（724年7月4日））は、飛鳥時代から奈良時代にかけての貴族。
sen.e: Kose no Oji (born unknown and passed away on July 4, 724) was a noble from the Asuka to the Nara periods.
KOSE no Oji (born unknown and passed away on July 4, 724) was a noble from the Asuka to the Nara periods.

sen.j: 祖父は難波朝左大臣大繍巨勢徳多、父は中納言小錦中巨勢黒麻呂。
sen.e: His grandfather was Kose no Tokuta, who was Daishu (the third grade of nineteen grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Shonii, Senior Second Rank of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code) and Sadaijin (minister of the left) of the Naniwa Court and his father was Kose no Kuromaro, who was Chunagon (Middle councellor) and Shokin (which corresponds to Shogoinojo and Shogoinoge, Senior Fifth Rank, Upper and Lower Grades and Jugoinojo and Jugoinoge, Junior Fifth Rank, Upper and Lower Grades of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code).
sen.cmt: 巨勢徳多, 難波朝, 巨勢黒麻呂の読み方（定訳）が確認出来ませんでした。
sen.e: His grandfather was KOSE no Tokuta, who was Daishu (the third grade of nineteen grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Shonii, Senior Second Rank of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code) and Sadaijin (minister of the left) of the Naniwa Court and his father was KOSE no Kuromaro, who was Chunagon (Middle councilor) and Shokin (which corresponds to Shogoinojo and Shogoinoge, Senior Fifth Rank, Upper and Lower Grades and Jugoinojo and Jugoinoge, Junior Fifth Rank, Upper and Lower Grades of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code).
sen.cmt: ・「巨勢」は大文字にしました。・「難波朝」はウィキペディアによると「なにわちょう」と読むようです。http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:3g-Sp2kXNAAJ:ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%AD%9D%E5%BE%B3%E5%A4%A9%E7%9A%87+%E9%9B%A3%E6%B3%A2%E6%9C%9D&cd=1&hl=ja&ct=clnk&gl=jp・「巨勢徳多」はウィキペディアでは「こせのとくた／とくだ」と出ています。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%A8%E5%8B%A2%E5%BE%B3%E5%A4%9A・「巨勢黒麻呂」は「こせのくろまろ」と読むようです。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B7%A8%E5%8B%A2%E5%AD%90%E9%82%91%E6%B2%BB
sen.e: His grandfather was KOSE no Tokuta, who was Daishu (the third grade of nineteen grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Shonii, Senior Second Rank of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code) and Sadaijin (minister of the left) of the Naniwa Court and his father was KOSE no Kuromaro, who was Chunagon (Middle councilor) and Shokin (which corresponds to Shogoinojo and Shogoinoge, Senior Fifth Rank, Upper and Lower Grades and Jugoinojo and Jugoinoge, Junior Fifth Rank, Upper and Lower Grades of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code).

sen.j: 文武天皇の御世、従五位下で遣唐使として唐に遣わされ、慶雲4年3月2日 (旧暦)（707年4月12日）に帰国、綿、麻布、鍬、籾を賜る。
sen.e: During the reign of Emperor Mommu, Kose no Oji, with the title of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade). was sent to Tanng Dynasty China as a Japanese envoy and came back to Japan on April 12, 707; he was given cotton, hemp, a hoe and unhulled rice.

During the reign of Emperor Mommu, KOSE no Oji, with the title of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) was sent to Tang Dynasty China as a Japanese envoy and came back to Japan on April 12, 707; he was given cotton, hemp, cloth, a hoe and unhulled rice.
sen.cmt: ・Tangのスペルを修正しました。・「布」が抜けていたので追加しました。

sen.j: 同年8月16日 (旧暦)（707年9月20日）に正五位上に昇進し、元明天皇の御世となった和銅元年3月13日 (旧暦)（708年4月12日）に播磨国守に任ぜられる。
sen.e: On September 20, 707, he was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and on April 12, 708, during the reign of Emperor Genmei, was appointed to Harima no kuni no kami (the governor of Harima Province).

sen.j: その後霊亀元年5月10日 (旧暦)（715年6月19日）に従四位上となり、同年5月22日 (旧暦)（715年7月1日）に右大弁に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He was promoted to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) on June 19, 715 and appointed to Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right) on July 1, 715.

sen.e: During the reign of Emperor Gensho, he was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) on February 10, 719 and appointed to the inspector of Settsu Promince on October 29, 719.

sen.j: 養老5年3月25日 (旧暦)（721年4月25日）、中納言従三位となり、神亀3年6月6日 (旧暦)（724年7月4日）に没す。
sen.e: He was appointed to Chunagon (Middle Counselor), Jusani (Junior Third Rank) on April 25, 721 and passed away on July 4, 724.
